body: Concept ACK
Not sure if this is correct, if `out.nDepth > 0` then `out.tx` should not be in the mempool right? Or should the condition be `out.nDepth == 0`?

Should this also add the no ancestor case?
```
{
    ...
    "ancestorcount": 0,
    "ancestorsize": 0,
    "ancestorfees": 0,
    ....
}
```
If the aim is to avoid adding unnecessary size to responses, then the help message above might mention these fields will only print if ancestors exist.
Thank you Luke for taking it into consideration and adding it !
Concept ACK, perhaps it'd be cleaner to sub-object them like you put in the title of the PR
Concept ACK
@luke-jr is this still relevant? There are a couple of suggestions above and it's missing test(s) update.
utACK daeb431011eefb35b9c76c0b1072d44ac40fe2a6
@promag Indeed, needs a trivial test where they are all different from 0

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19556 (Remove mempool global by MarcoFalke)
* #19306 (refactor: Replace RecursiveMutex with Mutex in CTxMemPool by hebasto)
* #18044 (Use wtxid for transaction relay by sdaftuar)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

They are only present (optional) when unconfirmed? Should mention that, or make then unconditional.

             "    \"amount\" : x.xxx,         (numeric) the transaction output amount in " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "\n"
             "    \"confirmations\" : n,      (numeric) The number of confirmations\n"
+            "    \"ancestorcount\" : n,      (numeric) The number of unconfirmed ancestors if spent\n"
+            "    \"ancestorsize\" : n,       (numeric) The virtual transaction size of all unconfirmed ancestors\n"
+            "    \"ancestorfees\" : n,       (numeric) The modified fees of all unconfirmed ancestors\n"

body: ancestor* fields always include the transaction itself

It's calculated above: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12677/files#diff-a01d25e7f69f4199a300a53bb4ff9957R56

(but yes, I need to update the size one to vsize...)

diff_hunk:
@@ -69,11 +69,22 @@ def run_test(self):
         fee = Decimal("0.0001")
         # MAX_ANCESTORS transactions off a confirmed tx should be fine
         chain = []
+        wallet_unspent = self.nodes[0].listunspent(minconf=0)
+        ancestor_vsize = 0
+        ancestor_fees = Decimal(0)
         for i in range(MAX_ANCESTORS):
             (txid, sent_value) = self.chain_transaction(self.nodes[0], txid, 0, value, fee, 1)
             value = sent_value
             chain.append(txid)
 
+            wallet_unspent = self.nodes[0].listunspent(minconf=0)
+            this_unspent = next(i for i in wallet_unspent if i['txid'] == txid)
+            assert_equal(this_unspent['ancestorcount'], i + 1)
+            ancestor_vsize += self.nodes[0].getrawtransaction(txid=txid, verbose=True)['vsize']
+            assert_equal(this_unspent['ancestorsize'], ancestor_vsize)
+            ancestor_fees -= self.nodes[0].gettransaction(txid=txid)['fee']
+            assert_equal(this_unspent['ancestorfees'], ancestor_fees * 100000000)

body: Is using `Optional` preferred nowadays for params that can be `{}`?
might be a good meeting topic?
`AvailableCoins` filters negative values but that takes a little code snooping to assure the reader. Can we make it easier on the reader and make this `out.nDepth == 0`?

> Naming request: in the code and the RPC output, could ancestorsize, ancestorfees, and ancestorcount be snakecased?

@jonatack No, we already have these names in the RPC interface as-is (see `MempoolEntryDescription`).
